intro: Palicourea campyloneura, commonly known as the curly-stemmed palicourea, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its slender, twisting stems and small, opposite leaves. It produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers, which are often followed by small, berry-like fruits. Palicourea campyloneura is typically found in humid, shaded environments such as rainforests and undergrowth.
